title: ITV Forced To Apologise For Running ‘Insensitive' ‘You've Been Framed' Clip About Cilla Black
text:
ITV Forced To Apologise For Running ‘Insensitive' ‘You've Been Framed' Clip About Cilla Black The Huffington Post UK | By Matt Bagwell 
Viewers have blasted ITV for running an old episode of ‘ You’ve Been Framed ’ which featured an insensitive ‘joke’ about Cilla Black. READ MORE: Sheridan Pays Her Respects To Cilla After Awards Win 
The channel has been forced to apologise after showing a repeat of an episode of the home video-based show from October 2014. 
In the video, an unidentified redhead can be seen attempting to run across a set of inflatable objects in a swimming pool. 
The offending clip featured woman in a swimming pool 
Presenter Harry Hill then jokes: "And here's Cilla Black's last show for ITV. Cilla's super splash down." 
As the woman races across the pool, she stumbles, falls and hits her head on the side of the pool. 
Harry Hill then adds: "Surprise Surprise!" 
Cilla died at her home in Spain in August after falling and banging her head. 
After the clip was aired, many furious viewers contacted Ofcom to complain. 
Cilla Black 
ITV have since apologised, admitting that airing the original clip was an ‘oversight’. 
In a statement to The Sun, an ITV spokesperson said: "This episode was first broadcast in October 2014. 
"We have production processes in place to re-edit programmes in circumstances such as this, but regrettably the clip was not cut on this occasion." 
Meanwhile, ITV is planning a tribute to the late star in a one-off special to honour the singer-turned-presenter. 
The hour-long documentary is due to air over Christmas.
